text:
Installing Textgram Open the Play Store. It's the multicolored triangle icon (usually on a white briefcase) in your app drawer. Type Textgram into the search box. A list of search results will expand. Tap Textgram – write on photos. It should be the first option in the list. Tap INSTALL. Tap ACCEPT. The app will now download to your Android. When the installation is complete, a Textgram icon will appear in the app drawer (and possibly the home screen, depending on your settings). Using Textgram Open Textgram. Its icon looks like a sheet of paper that says “Textgram” on a brown background. Tap Skip. It's at the bottom-left corner of the screen. This brings you to the Textgram home screen. Tap +. It's in the red circle at the bottom-right corner of the screen. Tap Template mode. Tap Image. Tap the image on which you want to write text. The selected image will now appear in Textgram. If the image displays upside-down or facing the wrong direction, tap the rotate button (the curved arrow with a diamond at the bottom-right corner of the screen) until it appears correctly. To fit the image on the screen, tap it once, then use two fingers to pinch outward (as if you were zooming in). This will automatically erase the highlighted text, replacing it with your own. Tap UPDATE TEXT. Now you'll see your text on the image. Edit your text. Use any of the icons beneath the image to change the way the text appears. Tap Format to make text bold, underlined, centered, aligned right or left. Tap Font to change the font face and color. Tap Text Size to make text larger or smaller. Tap Next when you're finished. It's at the top-right corner of the screen. Tap . A list of sharing options will appear. Tap Instagram. If prompted, tap Just Once to open Instagram. You should now see your image with its text in the Instagram editor. Tap the arrow to continue. It's at the top-right corner of the screen. Select a filter and tap Next. If you don't want to edit your photo, you can skip this step. Tap Share to post the image. If you want, you can add your own caption before sharing the image. Once the post is shared, your followers will see your image with the added text.
